comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Grover Cleveland's daughter Marion Cleveland (1895-1977), married in 1917 to William Stanley Dell. After he died she married John Harlan Amen. Marion Cleveland was community relations advisor for the Girl Scouts of America; her second husband was on the American legal staff at the Nuremberg Trials. Her gravesite: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=22675796

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Grover Cleveland died in 1908. His young wife, the former Frances Folsom, was married again in 1913, to Thomas J. Preston, Jr. This explains the printed caption visible in the picture of their daughter. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frances_Folsom_Cleveland_Preston

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of November 20, 1914 reports on Marion's introduction as a debutante. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30E13FB3C5C13738...
